intro: Terminalia brachystemma subsp. brachystemma, commonly known as the African wild date tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark and elliptical leaves. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by edible, sweet, sticky fruits resembling dates. It is often found in dry savannas and woodlands, and its fruits are an important food source for both wildlife and humans.
